original: MOGENSEN, Gustav Ove, överingenjör, Falun, f 1/8 92 av öv.lantm B K M o Ruth Kjellin, gm Elsa Samuelson. CTH (eltekn) 15, Provrumsing motorfabr Eck, Partille, 15—16, distr.ch.ass Älvkarleby kraftvk 16—18, förest Hallsta-Rimforsa elvk 18—19, övering Älvk.-bynät:s elektr centralfrn 19—23, start Dal:s? el konsult.byrå 23, sekr S Siljansdal :s kraft -förv.frn upa sed. 24, grund o tekn ch Falu rundradiostn. V. ordf Falu radioklubb, flygklubb o fastigh.äg.frn. Resor: Tyskl 13—1* samt årl 36—41, Ital 40. CTH högsta utn* f elever, John EricsonM. Hobbies: Tekn froskn (spec radio), flygning.
translated: MOGENSEN, Gustav Ove, chief engineer, Falun, b. 1/8 92, son of Lieutenant B K M and Ruth Kjellin, married to Elsa Samuelson. Graduated from CTH (electrical engineering) in 1915. Worked as a test engineer at motor factory Eck, Partille, from 1915 to 1916, district chief assistant at Älvkarleby power station from 1916 to 1918, head of Hallsta-Rimforsa power station from 1918 to 1919, chief engineer at Älvkaby district electric central station from 1919 to 1923. Started Dalarna's electrical consulting firm in 1923, secretary at S Siljansdal's power plant since 1924, founder and technical director of Falun radio station. Vice chairman of Falun radio club, flying club, and real estate owner. Traveled to Germany in 1913-1914 and yearly from 1936-1941, and to Italy in 1940. Received the highest honors from CTH as a student, John Ericson Medal. Hobbies include technical research (specifically radio) and flying.

structured.name: Gustav Ove Mogensen
structured.description: Chief Engineer Gustav Ove Mogensen, born on August 1, 1892 in Falun, Sweden. He is the son of Lieutenant B K M and Ruth Kjellin. He is married to Elsa Samuelson. Gustav completed his education in Electrical Engineering from CTH (Chalmers University of Technology) and has worked in various positions throughout his career. Apart from his professional achievements, Gustav has been actively involved in the Falun radio club, flying club, and real estate ownership. He received the John Ericson Medal and highest honors from CTH. Gustav's hobbies include technical research, particularly in the field of radio, and flying.
